climbs.name: Stains of the Stars
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Todd Swain, and Derrick, March 1986

content.description: A short crux overhang leads to a 5.8-5.9 fist crack.
content.location: on the northwest end of the rock

content.description:
Almost on the exact opposite side of the rock as the popular

Just Another Roadside Attraction

will you find this route. The route is an easy way to set a TR on Roadside Attraction. Look for the wide slanting crack that marks the start of the route.
content.protection: wide part at the bottom will take 5" gear. sling horns at the top for an anchor.

content.description:
Climb the large crack just left of "Just Another Roadside Attraction". Watch out for loose, grainy rock and questionably holds. Not more than 5.7 until a final groveling, humping move over a bulge to top out.

You can climb this, and afterwards you will be warmer, but I would hesitate to call it a warm-up.
content.protection: Standard, you can fit a #4 if you feel so inclined. Some hand size for the anchor.
content.location: Wide crack to the left of Roadsie Attraction. Walk off to the east.

content.description: This is a fun climb located literally roadside. It follows the obvious crack system up the middle of the face, and being so close to the road you could almost belay from the passenger seat of your new shiny H2...make sure and smile at all the tourists that are creating the traffic jam behind them. I've done this route a few times and always had a couple of cars stop for photos of my friends and I on the route. Maybe give them something to talk about and take a small whipper on purpose (wink, wink).
content.protection: .5 - 3 Camalot including the anchor. Descend via the east side of the formation.

content.description: Climb the Crack to the right of  "Just Another Roadside Attraction".
